sen.j: 大内 弘茂（おおうち ひろしげ、？ - 1401年（応永8年））は、室町時代前期の武将。
sen.e: Hiroshige OUCHI (died in 1401) was a general of the early Muromachi period.
Hiroshige OUCHI (died in 1401) was a general who lived during the early Muromachi period.

sen.j: 大内氏第9代当主・大内弘世の七男。
sen.e: He was the seventh son of Hiroyo OUCHI, the ninth head of Ouchi family.

sen.j: 第10代当主・大内義弘の弟。
sen.e: He was a younger brother of the tenth family head, Yoshihiro OUCHI.
He was also a younger brother of the tenth family head, Yoshihiro OUCHI.

sen.j: 1399年、応永の乱のときに兄に従って堺市に籠城したが、兄が将軍・足利義満率いる幕府軍の火攻めにあって戦死したため、その軍門に降った。
sen.e: In Oei Rebellion in 1399, he held up in a castle in Sakai City following his elder brother, however, as the elder brother was killed in a fire attack launched by the army of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) commanded by Shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, he surrendered to Yoshimitsu.

During the Oei Rebellion in 1399, he joined his elder brother in holding a castle in Sakai City against the army of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) led by Shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA; when his elder brother was killed in a fire attack launched by the besieging army, however, Hiroshige surrendered to Yoshimitsu.
sen.cmt: The translation is fairly chokuyaku and a bit difficult to follow. Only looking at the English I would have no idea what "he held up in a castle in Sakai City following his elder brother" meant. Please make sure you translate the meaning rather than just the words.I do think "fire attack" seems a little unnatural, but without knowing the details of how this was carried out, I can't be sure of what a more appropriate term might be.
sen.e: During the Oei War in 1399, he joined his older brother in holding a castle in Sakai City against the army of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) led by Shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA; however his older brother was killed in the attack of the besieging army by setting fire to the castle, and Hiroshige surrendered to Yoshimitsu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 義満は戦後の大内氏に対する処罰として、豊前国・石見国・和泉国・紀伊国を没収すると同時に、弘茂が義満に臣従することを条件として家督相続と周防国・長門国二ヶ国の所領のみ安堵されたのである。
sen.e: As a punishment on the Ouchi family for rebellion, Yoshimitsu confiscated Buzen Province, Iwami Province, Izumi Provinces and Kii Province, and at the same time, on condition that Hiroshige renders homage and service to Yoshimitsu, Yoshimitsu approved Hiroshige's succession to the Ouchi's house, and granted fiefs in Suo Province and Nagato Province.

To punishm the Ouchi family for the rebellion, Yoshimitsu confiscated Buzen Province, Iwami Province, Izumi Provinces and Kii Province, but, on condition that Hiroshige pay him homage and render him service, Yoshimitsu approved Hiroshige's succession to the head of the Ouchi family, and granted hm fiefs in Suo Province and Nagato Province.

To punish the Ouchi family for the War, Yoshimitsu confiscated Buzen Province, Iwami Province, Izumi Province and Kii Province, but, on condition that Hiroshige pay him homage and render him service, Yoshimitsu approved Hiroshige's succession to the head of the Ouchi family, and granted him fiefs in Suo Province and Nagato Province.

sen.j: ところが、本国の留守を守っていた大内盛見が所領没収に従わずに義満に反抗したため、義満は弘茂に盛見の討伐を命じる。
sen.e: However, Yoshimitsu ordered Hiroshige to subdue Moriharu OUCHI, who was taking care of Ouchi's house in Hiroshige's absence, because Moriharu rebelled against Yoshimitsu by defying Yoshimitsu's order to confiscate the Ouchi's territory.

However, Moriharu OUCHI, who was taking care of the Ouchi house in Hiroshige's absence, defied Yoshimitsu's orders to give up the Ouchi's territory, and so Yoshimitsu ordered Hiroshige to bring down Moriharu.

sen.j: 弘茂は義満や安芸国、石見の諸大名から支援を受けて盛見と戦い、一時はこれを豊前に放逐したが、1401年12月に反攻してきた盛見の軍勢と長府の四王司山城で戦うが敗れ、同じく長府の佐加利山城において討ち取られた。
sen.e: Receiving support from Yoshimitsu and feudal loads of Agi Province and Iwami Province, Hiroshige fought against Moriharu and expelled him to Buzen Province for a short time, however in December 1401, Hiroshige fought with Moriharu and his troops that launched a counterattack at Shiojiyama-jo Castle in Chofu Province, but he was defeated and killed at Sakariyama-jo Castle in Chofu Province.

With support from Yoshimitsu and the feudal loads of Agi Province and Iwami Province, Hiroshige attacked Moriharu and temperorarily succeeded in expelling him into Buzen Province, but Moriharu and his troops launched a counterattack at Shiojiyama-jo Castle in Chofu Province in December 1401, and Hiroshige was defeated and subsequently killed at Sakariyama-jo Castle in the same Province.

With support from Yoshimitsu and the feudal loads of Aki Province and Iwami Province, Hiroshige attacked Moriharu and temporarily succeeded in expelling him into Buzen Province, but Moriharu and his troops launched a counterattack at Shiojiyama-jo Castle in Chofu Province in December 1401, and Hiroshige was defeated and subsequently killed at Sakariyama-jo Castle in the Chofu Province.
